title: Massive bug in  game 1 of SKT vs OG.
body:
Look at Soaz.

Shoutcasters said Emperors Divide was "slowing" him down, but Kennen was not slowed down, he simply could not move, despite his Walking animation being actually playing the whole time.

And he wasn't getting knocked back by the wall either.

http://oddshot.tv/shot/riot-games-20151024152356888

replies.body: It would seem the soldiers don't know what to do if someone flashes into their hitbox.
The player still has to attack with them. They don't attack on their own.

He is talking about the Ult spawned soldiers.

Not about the regular soldiers.
The ult soldiers don't do anything but impair movement. So I just assumed he was talking about the arise ones.

yeah, they don't allow you to move or dash through them.

But blinks are different.

IT wasn't a gameplay bug, it worked as intended, he flashed into the emperors divide it was more of a visual bug. 

As you can clearly see he didn't get past the soldiers, they just visually bugged out kennen, since it was so close, to the wall.

https://imgur.com/GMYjTfm

When that happens, the target or targets affected by Emperors Divide will simply travel through the wall after the very first knock back.

That was the fix Riot gave to the cheese Azir could pull off by Ulting you against a wall and pinning you down for 4 seconds.

Also

>** IT wasn't a bug**, it worked as intended, he flashed into the emperors divide **it was more of a visual bug**. 

so is it a bug or is it not a bug?

---

Don't get me wrong.

As much as I would like for OG to win, I'm not asking for a Remake here.

The game was already decided anyway and even if Soaz managed to catch Kalista there, her flash was still up.

I'm just stating there was a Massive bug there.
Ok, it wasn't A GAMEPLAY bug, My bad for the wording.

it was though. after the first bounce, you are supposed to be displaced into a position you can move from. assuming kennan was actually displaced somewhere behind the soldiers in game logic and just didnt show visually, then kennan somehow moved past the soldiers after being bounced... which would be a gameplay bug too. what actually happened is he made it past the soldiers somehow (through displacement vs wall logic most likely) and met up resistance to moving afterward from spaghetti code that knew he shouldn't be there
Yeah, that ult can still pin you against a wall so that you can't do anything

To be honest Soaz flashed in between Azir's ult and the other wall. The fact that he moved was because of the weird interaction between enemies pushed against the wall with Azir's ult.
*I'm not saying the bug should remain, it should have either pinned him to the wall or let him pass*
Azir has a lot of bugs every time i play him i find bugs. His passive turret and his ult the most.
But Riot will never disable Azir since SKT might actually lose.

it honestly was more about Fiora than anything else.

but that didn't change the fact that there was a Massive Bug during that fight that the shoutcasters simply ignored.

It was also the only fight that didn't deserve an actual replay for some reason.

If that bug hadn't happened, OG might have won that fight and may have turned the game around. 

That game once again proved how OP Fiora is in most matchups.
if the bug had instead been correct behavior, kennen would have been pushed away from the enemies
Yes, and he would have been able to do something rather than being stuck.

Not really. He used Flash to get over the wall - had Azir's ult been coded correctly, he would've been knocked back over the wall, meaning that either way SoaZ wouldn't have been able to do anything (he'd have to either walk around the Azir ult or the wall he should've gotten knocked over - either way, the fight had ended by then and both teams were split apart)

It's a Bug.

Riot hardcoded the wall on spawn to knock people over walls to prevent you from intentionally pinning people into walls, but if the walls been up and you flash into that position it bugs out like crazy.

Super easy to reproduce.

i believe that since it was so late into the game and the fact that kennen flashed right into the side/end of the wall that it wasnt that big a deal. no one was gonna get caught at that point when he did it anyways.
To me, it was like Kennen flashed into the Azir wall, but for some reason he was still able to move in an incremental, start-stop motion.

Azir has so many bugs because his ult doesn't act as plain terrain like Anivia/Jarvan wall that blocks EVERYTHING and EVERYONE. It also has a hitbox that doesn't touch itself in a complete circle like Jarvan ult. It's like an Anivia wall but is supposed to push enemies back even after it's been deployed.

If you want to be technical, all non-permanent terrain is made up of minions (Azir ult included). Only difference it Azir's has the extra CC attached to it (with a hit/detection box) while the others can be ignored with a phantom dancer.
What..? You can't walk through a J4 ult or an Anivia wall with a Phantom Dancer... lol....

Trundle pillar too.
Only thing keeping you in is unit collision.
That's also why mobility skills that can't normally go over terrain (Vayne's tumble) can go through them.

J4's ult is the only one that works like that though. You can't Q through an Anivia wall or Trundle E and Vayne can't tumble through either of those. Vayne does have about fourish walls she can tumble over across the map, but she can't tumble an Anivia Wall. It's not the walls being supposedly 'made of minions', it's the width of the terrain as [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G49t4r0G3SU) shows you go over 4 different walls with Vayne's tumble. Unlike Riven's E, Riven's Q and Vayne's Q do actually go over terrain if it's thin enough and J4's wall is thinner than every wall in the game.
